basics.name: Zoltán Schmidt
basics.label: backend developer
basics.summary:
I'm just a random mid-20s guy from Hungary who loves developing stuff as well as using the same name literally everywhere on the Internet.

I use this site both as a semi-formal CV and a place to host various JS gibberish.

A lots of things are #TODO here - but for now, please enjoy your stay, check the code I'm hosting through this URL or contact me at one of the places listed on the left.
  • Worldbuilding: Terminus Nation
  • Worldbuilding: Deep Space Blizzard
  • Code golf
Credits: for the site design, Techfolios was used and customized.

work.summary: A somewhat loose contracting period during which I developed NodeJS based backend tools supporting the ecosystem of the cryptocurrency the company is developing. Was an interesting insight into the deeper working mechanics of Docker.

Backend-focused development duties on the major product of the company: an application that makes finding and occupying parking lots easier. The stack consists of Python and Django, with MySQL as database, and intense use of containerization (Docker).

Developing backend functionality of websites for a creative agency / hosting company. Most of my development is based on a custom content management system built on Phalcon (PHP framework) and involves in-house developments and normal projects alike.

No official specification for the field, but in practice, I was a frontend developer. As a part of Sonrisa Internation Inc., this company has taught me a lot about the everyday practices at a larger firm. Aside of the implicit knowledge, I gained significant experience in versioning (Git), issue tracking (Redmine, JIRA), and learned about Scrum. Stack-wise, I mostly worked with Angular, and had some involvement with JSP, too.

A very short job period originally intended to be my obligatory internship fulfillment, required by my university. My only duty was the testing of a billing machine used in public transport; and the creating of UI mockups for an upcoming project specification. As my first job ever, it was a refreshing and exciting experience nonetheless.
